channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The weight vice president Kamala Harris would bear
Watch SE Cupp's reaction to Biden's VP pick
item.description: After months of speculation, presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden revealed that Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA) will be his running mate. CNN's SE Cupp analyzes the decision.

item.title: The Red Bull heir, a crashed car and the scandal that angered Thailand
item.description: Before dawn on September 3, 2012, a roaring black Ferrari struck a police motorcycle in downtown Bangkok, knocking the officer to the ground and dragging his body down the darkened street before speeding away.

item.title: Russia's unproven Covid-19 vaccine will be available to other countries by November, funder says. But safety concerns remain
Hear Russian CEO's vaccine rollout plan that made Dr. Gupta suspicious
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta discuss their interview with Russia Direct Investment Fund CEO Kirill Dmitriev following Russian President Vladimir Putin's announcement about the approval of a coronavirus vaccine amid unanswered questions over its safety.

item.title: UK crashes into deepest recession of any major economy
item.description: UK economic output shrank by 20.4% in the second quarter of 2020, the worst quarterly slump on record, pushing the country into the deepest recession of any major global economy.

item.title: As tensions rise in Asia Pacific, South Korea is building its first aircraft carrier ... complete with US-made F-35B fighter jets
item.description: South Korea plans to start building its first aircraft carrier next year, and acquire fighter jets to operate on it, the country's Defense Ministry has announced.

item.title: Duterte says he would volunteer for trials of Russia's Covid-19 vaccine
Beer unsold during Australia's coronavirus lockdown has been turned into renewable energy
item.description: When Australia's coronavirus lockdown forced bars and restaurants to shut down in March, breweries were left with huge inventories of unsold, stale beer.

item.title: Thousands more tons of oil from stricken ship could spill into ocean, experts fear
item.description: A stricken ship off the coast of Mauritius which has already leaked about 1,000 metric tons of oil into a pristine Indian Ocean lagoon could be about to break in two, experts fear -- spelling disaster for the ecologically rich area.

item.title: Trump claims dog was sent a ballot. See election official's response
item.description: Colorado has had universal mail-in voting for seven years. George Stern helps oversee elections in Colorado and has invited President Trump to see how it's done. Lucy Kafanov reports.

item.title: US government strikes $1.525 billion deal with Moderna for 100 million doses of its vaccine
item.description: The Trump administration has reached a deal with Moderna Inc. to manufacture and deliver 100 million doses of the company's Covid-19 vaccine once it is approved, according to a news release from the US Health and Human Services Department.

item.title: Widower installs wax statue of late wife in dream home she tragically never got to see
item.description: An Indian widower has installed a life-sized wax statue of his late wife in the dream house they were building together before she died.

item.title: Here's how we got to 20 million coronavirus cases
item.description: The world has 20 million confirmed cases of Covid-19 with more than half of those from just 3 countries: Brazil, the United States and India. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

item.title: Trump claims Americans will have to learn Chinese if Biden wins election
item.description: In a pair of interviews on Tuesday, President Donald Trump railed against his competitor for being weak on China -- but stopped short himself of condemning China's repression of its Uyghur ethnic minority or its crackdown on political freedoms in Hong Kong.

item.title: Covid-19 returns to New Zealand after 102 days
item.description: New Zealand has reintroduced coronavirus restrictions in parts of the country after new locally transmitted cases broke the 102-day streak the country had gone without recording a local infection.

item.title: New dinosaur species related to Tyrannosaurus rex discovered by scientists in England
item.description: A new species of dinosaur related to the Tyrannosaurus rex has been discovered in England.

item.title: Crowds at motorcycle rally raise fears of super spreader event
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of motorcycle riders and enthusiasts have descended on Sturgis, South Dakota, for the annual motorcycle rally. The event is raising concerns about the spread of coronavirus. CNN's Ryan Young reports.

item.title: Dwarf planet in asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter is an ocean world, NASA finds
item.description: Ceres is a dwarf planet and the largest known object in the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter. And now we know it may be an ocean world with intriguing geologic activity taking place on and just below its surface, according to new research.

item.title: This company thinks bacteria can fix fashion's water pollution problem
item.description: In 2013, a team of Cambridge University scientists were in Nepal's Kathmandu Valley, developing a device to measure pollution in the region's waters.

item.title: Gray reef sharks form long-lasting social groups likely for hunting, study shows
item.description: We can't quite say sharks can be friends, but new evidence is showing us that sharks form social bonds with others and can work together to a degree.

item.title: A woman is stunned when her new driver's license came back with a picture of an empty chair
item.description: Driver's license photos are the worst, but one Tennessee woman is laughing after a clerical error left her with a picture of an empty chair.

item.title: The iPhone 12 feature that could convince millions of people to upgrade
item.description: Apple has long been expected to debut a batch of 5G-enabled iPhones this fall. Now it appears all of the company's new phone releases this year may be able to connect to the next generation of super-fast wireless networks, according to Wedbush analyst Dan Ives.

item.title: A rare giant shark now sits in an ice block at the Smithsonian, allowing researchers to hopefully unravel clues about its evolution
item.description: Researchers are hoping to unravel the mystery around one of the rarest sharks in the sea -- the megamouth.

item.title: The Lebanese government has resigned. Will revolution ensue?
item.description: Lebanon's government has stepped down in the wake of the deadly explosion in Beirut. Rage over the blast is fueling protest movements that demand the ouster of the country's ruling elites. CNN's Sam Kiley reports.

item.title: Corpse hidden for 30 years found during renovation of $41.2 million French mansion
item.description: French authorities have opened a murder investigation after a 30-year-old corpse was found in a basement during renovations of a Parisian mansion that sold for 35.1 million euros (about $41.2 million).

item.title: How one man and his cellphone in Canada rescued a group of Africans stuck in China
item.description: Even for 2020, with its once-in-a-generation global pandemic and the countless travel bans that have followed, this rescue mission seems a bit far-fetched.

item.title: Watch Kamala Harris' intense interrogations on the Hill
item.description: During her time as a senator, Kamala Harris has made her mark not in legislation, but in the hearing room, CNN's Maeve Reston says.

item.title: These 'wine holes' used during the Italian Plague are open again
item.description: Bars and restaurants around the world are having to rethink the way they interact with customers during the pandemic. In the Italian city of Florence, some are looking to the past: using centuries-old wine windows to dole out food and drinks.

item.title: Dramatic aerial photos showcase China's wild 'crimson beach'
item.description: No bathing suits are required to enjoy this Chinese beach.

item.title: Boeing lost more orders in July, but it's actually a bit of good news
item.description: Boeing lost orders for another 43 jets in July. But that's actually an improvement for the troubled aircraft maker's order book.

item.title: The 'fox eye' beauty trend continues to spread online. But critics insist it's racist
item.description: "Ching chong eyes!" That's what elementary school kids used to call Sophie Wang. It was an insidious racist slur casually thrown around as they mocked her Asian ethnicity while pulling on the corner of their eyes. Upward for Japanese. To the side for Chinese. Downward for Korean.

item.title: How to tell if your child is sick from Covid-19, based on pediatricians' advice
item.description: Are parents really supposed to be reassured by all this talk about "mild" cases of Covid-19 in children? What about the unfortunate "few" youngsters who have died or come down with a strange and severe associated illness?

item.title: This grandfather came out to his daughter at 90 years old
item.description: While writing his memoir, 90-year-old Kenneth Felts came out to his daughter as gay. He tells CNN's Anderson Cooper about Phillip, the man he loved, and his search to find him.

item.title: Woman without mask allegedly pushed against wall by police in Australia
item.description: Police in Australia have referred an arrest to its standards unit after footage emerged appearing to show a male officer pushing a woman up against a wall with his hands on her throat on Monday.

item.title: The earth was once home to 'terror crocodiles' nearly the size of city buses
item.description: A new study has shed more light on gigantic "terror crocodiles," that once roamed the world and preyed on dinosaurs with teeth "the size of bananas."

item.title: Watch neighbors pull together for driveway jazz concert
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper looks at what makes people happy during these uncertain times, from an 15-year-old synchronized ice skater landing an axel jump for the first time to a jazz concert in a driveway. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

item.title: Pregnant amid the pandemic: The highs and lows
item.description: In early February, my partner and I discovered that I was pregnant.

item.title: Was this 'the biggest mistake in sports history'?
item.description: When dreams clash with reality; when life reaches a daunting crossroads; when we must decide whether to be or make history.

item.title: World's last Blockbuster store becomes an Airbnb rental
item.description: You can -- and should -- eat popcorn in bed at this one-of-a-kind Airbnb. Located in Bend, Oregon, this rental has everything: a sofabed, free snacks, a VCR and a big TV.

item.title: Try this 5-minute yoga routine before bedtime
item.description: Having a morning routine to boost energy is a great way to start the day, but what if you wake up every morning knowing that your bedtime routine is really to blame for your lack of energy and focus?

item.title: If she becomes vice president, Harris' actions will surely test if her party can leave prejudices behind
item.description: Biden's historic choice | Harris in photos | Opinion: Harris' key strengths

item.title: Harris pick recasts future of Democratic power structure
Biden just sent an unmistakable message
item.description: Joe Biden thinks he is going to win the White House in 84 days' time.

item.title: Kamala Harris' Indian roots and why they matter
Trump turns to stereotypes as he responds to Harris pick
item.description: It took President Donald Trump less than two minutes to reach for the word "nasty" as he reacted to California Sen. Kamala Harris' historic selection as the first Black woman to join a major-party ticket.

item.title: This election nightmare is looking more and more likely
item.description: Only 84 days until the 2020 presidential election!

item.title: Putin attempts to turn Covid-19 vaccine into new Cold War
item.description: Covid-19 latest: Duterte 'would volunteer for Russia's Covid-19 vaccine' Russia's unproven coronavirus vaccine to be rolled out to high-risk people first

item.title: The Red Bull heir, a crashed car and the scandal that angered Thailand
Ex-Victoria's Secret CEO agreed to written deposition in Epstein accuser suit
item.description: Les Wexner, the former head of the parent company that owns Victoria's Secret, has agreed to answer written deposition questions in a lawsuit involving Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre and attorney Alan Dershowitz, but Dershowitz wants him to testify in person or on camera, according to newly unsealed documents.
